DS3 Manual
DS3: A System-Level Domain-Specific System-on-ChipSimulationFramework
DASH_SoC_parser.py
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 '''!
2 @brief This file contains the code to parse DASH-SoC given in config_file.ini file.
3 '''
4 import sys
5 import platform
6 import numpy as np
7 
8 import common # The common parameters used in DASH-Sim are defined in common_parameters.py
9 import clusters
10 
11 
12 def resource_parse(resource_matrix, file_name):
13  '''!
14  Read and parse the SoC configuration.
15  @param resource_matrix: Object to the resource matrix
16  @param file_name: SoC file name, as specified in the config_file.ini
17  '''
18  # In case of running platform is windows,opening and reading a file
19  # requires encoding = 'utf-8'
20  # In mac no need to specify encoding techique.
21 
22  try:
23  current_platform = platform.system() # Find the platform
24  if 'windows' in current_platform.lower():
25  input_file = open(file_name, "r", encoding = "utf-8") # Read the configuration file
26  elif 'darwin' in current_platform.lower():
27  input_file = open(file_name, 'r') # Read the configuration file
28  elif 'linux' in current_platform.lower():
29  input_file = open(file_name, 'r') # Read the configuration file
30 
31 
32  except IOError:
33  print("[E] Could not read configuration file that contains available resources in DASH-SoC")
34  print("[E] Please check if the file 'config_file.ini' has the correct file name")
35  sys.exit() # Print an error message, if the input file cannot be opened
36 
37  # Now, the file is open. Read the input lines one by one
38 
39  found_new_resource = False # The input lines do not correspond to a particular resource
40  # unless found_new_resource = = true;
41  # This variable shows the number of functionalities supported for a given resource
42  resource_list = []
43 
44  capacity = 1
45  last_PE_ID = 0
46  each_PE_functionality = 0
47  cluster_ID = 0
48  comm_band_self = 1
49 
50  common.ClusterManager.cluster_list = []
51 
52  for line in input_file:
53  input_line = line.strip("\n\r ") # Remove the end of line character
54  current_line = input_line.split(" ") # Split the input line into variables sepearated a space: " "
55  if ( (len(input_line) == 0) or (current_line[0] == "#") or
56  '#' in current_line[0]): # Ignore the lines that are empty or comments (start with #)
57  continue
58 
59  if not(found_new_resource):
60  if (current_line[0] == 'add_new_resource'): # The key word "add_new_resource" implies that the config file defines a new resource
61 
62  if int(current_line[8]) > 1:
63  capacity = int(current_line[8])
64  else:
65  capacity = 1
66 
67  new_cluster = clusters.Cluster(current_line[4], int(current_line[6]), current_line[2])
68  cluster_ID = int(current_line[6])
69 
70  for i in range(capacity):
71  new_resource = common.Resource()
72 
73  # print("Reading a new resource: ", current_line[1])
74  new_resource.type = current_line[2]
75 
76  # print("The name of the new resource: ", current_line[2])
77  new_resource.name = current_line[4]+'_'+str(i + last_PE_ID)
78 
79  #print("The ID of the new resource: ",i + last_PE_ID)
80  new_resource.ID = i + last_PE_ID
81  new_resource.cluster_ID = cluster_ID
82 
83  new_resource.capacity = 1
84 
85  # print("Number of functionalities supported by this resource: ",current_line[5])
86  new_resource.num_of_functionalities = int(current_line[10]) # Converting the input string to integer
87  each_PE_functionality = int(current_line[10])
88 
89  resource_list.append(last_PE_ID)
90  resource_matrix.list.append(new_resource)
91  new_cluster.PE_list.append(new_resource.ID)
92 
93  common.ResourceManager.comm_band = np.ones((len(resource_list),
94  len(resource_list))) # Initialize the communication volume matrix
95 
96  new_cluster.DVFS = current_line[12] # Obtain the DVFS mode for the given PE
97 
98  found_new_resource = True # Set the flag to indicate that the following lines define the funtionalities
99  last_PE_ID += capacity
100  common.ClusterManager.cluster_list.append(new_cluster)
101 
102  elif current_line[0] == 'comm_band_self':
103  comm_band_self = current_line[1]
104 
105  elif current_line[0] == 'comm_band':
106  # The key word "comm_band" implies that config file defines
107  # an element of communication bandwidth matrix
108  if int(current_line[1]) < len(resource_list) and int(current_line[2]) < len(resource_list):
109  cluster_source = int(current_line[1])
110  cluster_dest = int(current_line[2])
111  comm_band_value = int(current_line[3])
112 
113  comm_band_index_source = 0
114  comm_band_index_dest = 0
115  source_index_updated = False
116  dest_index_updated = False
117  for cluster in common.ClusterManager.cluster_list:
118  if cluster_source != cluster.ID:
119  if not source_index_updated:
120  comm_band_index_source += cluster.num_active_cores
121  else:
122  source_index_updated = True
123  source_cluster_capacity = cluster.num_active_cores
124 
125  if cluster_dest != cluster.ID:
126  if not dest_index_updated:
127  comm_band_index_dest += cluster.num_active_cores
128  else:
129  dest_index_updated = True
130  dest_cluster_capacity = cluster.num_active_cores
131 
132  # Fill the comm_band table with the bandwith values from the SoC config file when both indexes were updated
133  if source_index_updated and dest_index_updated:
134  for core_source in range(source_cluster_capacity):
135  for core_dest in range(dest_cluster_capacity):
136  if comm_band_index_source + core_source == comm_band_index_dest + core_dest:
137  comm_value = comm_band_self
138  else:
139  comm_value = comm_band_value
140  common.ResourceManager.comm_band[comm_band_index_source + core_source, comm_band_index_dest + core_dest] = comm_value
141  common.ResourceManager.comm_band[comm_band_index_dest + core_dest, comm_band_index_source + core_source] = comm_value
142  break
143  else:
144  print("[E] Cannot recognize the input line in resource file:", input_line )
145  sys.exit()
146 
147  # end of: if not(found_new_resource)
148 
149  else: # if not(found_new_resource) (i.e., found a new resource)
150 
151  if current_line[0] == 'opp':
152  # print("Reading a new OPP tuple for resource ID {0}: <{1},{2}>".format(common.ClusterManager.cluster_list[cluster_ID].ID, current_line[1], current_line[2]))
153  common.ClusterManager.cluster_list[cluster_ID].OPP.append((int(current_line[1]), int(current_line[2])))
154  elif current_line[0] == 'trip_freq':
155  for i, freq in enumerate(current_line):
156  if i != 0:
157  common.ClusterManager.cluster_list[cluster_ID].trip_freq.append(int(freq))
158  elif current_line[0] == 'DTPM_trip_freq':
159  for i, freq in enumerate(current_line):
160  if i != 0:
161  common.ClusterManager.cluster_list[cluster_ID].DTPM_trip_freq.append(int(freq))
162  elif current_line[0] == 'power_profile':
163  power_profile_list = []
164  frequency_threshold = 0
165  for i, val in enumerate(current_line):
166  if i == 1:
167  frequency_threshold = int(val)
168  if i > 1:
169  power_profile_list.append(float(val))
170  common.ClusterManager.cluster_list[cluster_ID].power_profile.update({frequency_threshold: power_profile_list})
171  elif current_line[0] == 'PG_profile':
172  power_profile_list = []
173  frequency_threshold = 0
174  for i, val in enumerate(current_line):
175  if i == 1:
176  frequency_threshold = int(val)
177  if i > 1:
178  power_profile_list.append(float(val))
179  common.ClusterManager.cluster_list[cluster_ID].PG_profile.update({frequency_threshold: power_profile_list})
180  elif (current_line[0] == 'mesh_information'):
181  for ii in range(capacity):
182 
183  length = len(resource_matrix.list)
184  ind_PE = length-1-ii
185  # print("Mesh name of the resource: ", current_line[1])
186  resource_matrix.list[ind_PE].mesh_name = current_line[1]
187 
188  # print("Mesh position of the resource", current_line[2])
189  resource_matrix.list[ind_PE].position = current_line[2]
190 
191  # print("Height of the resource: ", current_line[3])
192  resource_matrix.list[ind_PE].height = current_line[3]
193 
194  # print("Width of the resource: ", current_line[4])
195  resource_matrix.list[ind_PE].width = current_line[4]
196 
197  # print("Color of the resource: ", current_line[5])
198  resource_matrix.list[ind_PE].color = current_line[5]
199  else:
200  for ii in range(capacity):
201 
202  length = len(resource_matrix.list)
203  ind_PE = length-1-ii
204 
205  if (each_PE_functionality > len(resource_matrix.list[ind_PE].supported_functionalities)):
206  #print("Reading a new functionality: ", current_line[0])
207  resource_matrix.list[ind_PE].supported_functionalities.append(current_line[0])
208 
209  #print("The runtime for this functionality: ", current_line[1])
210  resource_matrix.list[ind_PE].performance.append(float(current_line[1]))
211 
212  #print("number of functionality read: ", num_functionality_read)
213 
214  # Reset these variables, since we completed reading the current resource
215  if (each_PE_functionality == len(resource_matrix.list[ind_PE].supported_functionalities) and ii == (capacity-1)):
216  found_new_resource = False
217  each_PE_functionality = 0
218  common.ClusterManager.cluster_list[cluster_ID].OPP = sorted(common.ClusterManager.cluster_list[cluster_ID].OPP)
219  common.ClusterManager.cluster_list[cluster_ID].num_active_cores = len(common.ClusterManager.cluster_list[cluster_ID].PE_list)
220  common.ClusterManager.cluster_list[cluster_ID].num_total_cores = len(common.ClusterManager.cluster_list[cluster_ID].PE_list)
221 
222  # end of else: # if not(found_new_resource)
223 
224  # Number of resources, ignore the memory
225  common.num_PEs_TRACE = len(common.ClusterManager.cluster_list) - 1
226 
227 
common.Resource
Define the Resource class to define a resource.
Definition: common.py:213
clusters.Cluster
The Cluster class will help manage the power of the SoC.
Definition: clusters.py:5

Read and parse the SoC configuration.
